sentences.en: After the disaster caused by Nazism, one of the priorities was to delegitimize the ideology of the inequality of races.
sentences.cn: 在纳粹主义造成的灾难之后，一个首要的问题就是使种族不平等的意识形态去合法化。

sentences.en: He joined the French resistance to combat Nazism, editing an underground newspaper, Combat.
sentences.cn: 他加入过法国抵抗组织,对纳粹作战, 主办了一份地下报纸《战斗》.

sentences.en: His philosophical eyes were obviously shortsighted by the evil influence of Nazism.
sentences.cn: 显然,他那双哲学家般的深邃的眼睛也被纳粹的妖氛所眩惑.

sentences.en: Interned in a German camp during World War II, she escaped to America and went on to make sense of the horrors of Nazism and Stalinism in her writing.
sentences.cn: 二战期间，阿伦特从一间德国拘役所逃往美国。 而在其著作中，她对纳粹主义和集权主义的恐怖之处做出了深度思考。

sentences.en: Nazism suppressed all three movements as degenerate.
sentences.cn: 纳粹把所有三个运动都作为颓废艺术而加以镇压.

sentences.en: The 1936 Berlin Games is remembered for its Nazism.
sentences.cn: 1936年的奥运会笼罩着纳粹的阴霾.

sentences.en: The new Nazism is resurging in some places in Germany.
sentences.cn: 新纳粹主义正在德国的一些地方复活.

trans.tran_en: Nazism was the political ideas and activities of the German Nazi Party
